properties.name: value
properties.doc: Bound to the selected Scenario^, or None if there is none.

properties.name: show_add_button
properties.doc: If False, the button to create a new scenario is not displayed.

properties.name: display_cycles
properties.doc: If False, the cycles are not shown.

properties.name: show_primary_flag
properties.doc: If False, the primary scenarios are not identified with specific visual hint.

properties.name: on_change
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when the value is updated.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the variable name.
  • value (Scenario^): the selected scenario.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height, in CSS units, of the tree.

properties.name: show_pins
properties.doc: If True, a pin is shown on each item of the selector and allows to restrict the numnber of displayed items.

properties.name: on_creation
properties.doc:
The name of the function that is triggered when a scenario is about to be created.

All the parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (str): the identifier of the scenario selector.
  • action (str): the name of the action that provoked the invocation of the callback.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • config: the name of the selected scenario configuration.
    • date: the creation date for the new scenario.
    • name: the user entered name.
    • properties: a dictionnary.
  • return: the callback can return a scenario, a string containing an error message (a scenario will not be created) or None (then a new scenario is created with the user parameters).

properties.name: scenario
properties.doc:
The scenario to display and edit.
If the value is a list, it must have a single element otherwise nothing is shown.

properties.name: active
properties.doc:
Indicates if this component is active.
An inactive component allows no user interaction.

properties.name: expandable
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario visualizer can be expanded.
If False, the scenario visualizer is not expandable and it is shown depending on expanded value.

properties.name: expanded
properties.doc:
If True, when a valid scenario is selected, the scenario visualizer is expanded and its content is displayed.
If False, the scenario visualizer is collapsed and only its name and submit button are visible.

properties.name: show_submit
properties.doc: If False, the scenario submit button is not visible.

properties.name: show_delete
properties.doc: If False, the button to delete a scenario is not visible.

properties.name: show_config
properties.doc: If False, the scenario configuration label is not visible.

properties.name: show_cycle
properties.doc: If False, the scenario cycle label is not visible.

properties.name: show_tags
properties.doc: If False, the scenario tags are not visible.

properties.name: show_properties
properties.doc: If False, the scenario properties are not visible.

properties.name: show_pipelines
properties.doc: If False, the scenario pipelines are not visible.

properties.name: show_submit_pipelines
properties.doc: If False, the buttons to submit scenario pipelines are not visible.

properties.name: scenario
properties.doc:
The Scenario^ whose diagram is displayed.
If the value is a list, it must have a single element otherwise nothing is shown.

properties.name: render
properties.doc: If False, this scenario's DAG is not displayed.

properties.name: show_toolbar
properties.doc: If False, the DAG toolbar is not visible.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height, in CSS units, of the DAG.

properties.name: width
properties.doc: The maximum width, in CSS units, of the DAG.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: Bound to the selected DataNode^(s), or None if there is none.

properties.name: display_cycles
properties.doc: If False, the cycles are not shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_primary_flag
properties.doc: If False, the primary scenarios are not identified with specific visual hint.

properties.name: on_change
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when a datanode is selected.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the variable name.
  • value (DataNode^): the selected datanode.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height, in CSS units,of the tree.

properties.name: show_pins
properties.doc: If True, a pin is shown on each item of the selector and allows to restrict the numnber of displayed items.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: Bound to the selected Job^(s), or None if there is none.

properties.name: show_job_id
properties.doc: If False, the Job^ id is not shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_entity_label
properties.doc: If False, the Entity^ label is not shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_entity_id
properties.doc: If True, the Entity^ id is shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_submit_id
properties.doc: If True, the Submit^ id is shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_date
properties.doc: If False, the Job^ date is not shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_cancel
properties.doc: If False, the cancel buttons are not shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_delete
properties.doc: If False, the delete button are not shown in the selector.

properties.name: on_change
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when the selection is updated.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the variable name.
  • value (Job^): the selected job.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height, in CSS units,of the tree.

properties.name: data_node
properties.doc:
The datanode to display and edit.
If the value is a list, it must have a single element otherwise nothing is shown.

properties.name: active
properties.doc:
Indicates if this component is active.
An inactive component allows no user interaction.

properties.name: expandable
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario visualizer can be expanded.
If False, the scenario visualizer is not expandable and it is shown depending on expanded value.

properties.name: expanded
properties.doc:
If True, when a valid scenario is selected, the scenario visualizer is expanded and its content is displayed.
If False, the scenario visualizer is collapsed and only its name and submit button are visible.

properties.name: show_config
properties.doc: If False, the datanode configuration label is not visible.

properties.name: show_owner
properties.doc: If False, the datanode owner label is not visible.

properties.name: show_edit_date
properties.doc: If False, the datanode edition date is not visible.

properties.name: show_expiration_date
properties.doc: If False, the datanode expiration date is not visible.

properties.name: show_properties
properties.doc: If False, the datanode properties are not visible.

properties.name: show_history
properties.doc: If False, the datanode history is not visible.

properties.name: show_data
properties.doc: If False, the datanode value is not visible.

properties.name: chart_config
properties.doc: Chart configs by datanode configuration id.

properties.name: scenario
properties.doc: Bound to the selected Scenario^ from the owner list of Scenarios, or None if there is none.

properties.name: id
properties.doc: The identifier that will be assigned to the rendered HTML component.

properties.name: class_name
properties.doc:
The list of CSS class names that will be associated with the generated HTML Element.
These class names will be added to the default taipy_gui_core-<element_type>.
